name: axext4
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wb(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))

stmt.origin: impbii(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))

body.origin:
|- wb(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
-| wi(wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))

-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
-| wi(wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))

stmt.origin: alrimiv(s2, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1))))
stmt.pretty: alrimiv(s2, s0 = s1, (s2 ∈ s0 ↔ s2 ∈ s1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
-| diffss(s2, s0)

-| diffsw(s2, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
-| diffss(s2, s0)

body.origin:
|- diffsw(s2, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
-| diffsc(s2, cv(s0))
-| diffsc(s2, cv(s1))

cumulated.origin:

-| diffss(s2, s0)
-| diffss(s2, s1)
-| diffsc(s2, cv(s0))

|- wb(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))

-| diffss(s2, s1)
-| diffss(s0, s2)

|- wb(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
-| diffss(s0, s2)
-| diffss(s1, s2)

comment: A bidirectional version of Extensionality. Although this theorem "looks" like it is just a definition of equality, it requires the Axiom of Extensionality for its proof under our axiomatization. See the comments for ~ ax-ext and ~ df-cleq . (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2008.)
